name: get_trending_cryptos
description: Fetches a list of trending cryptocurrencies from coingecko. Use the rersponse to engage with the user conversationally, you can remark on the names of the crypto tokens if they're strange or amusing.

name: get_crypto_data_with_indicators_binance
description: Fetches various financial indicators and current data for a given list of cryptocurrencies using their ticker symbols to analyse and inform your user about the market conditions. Use this function one time for each query, regardless of the number of currencies that data is requested for. Use the information returned from this function to engage with the user conversationally on the subject matter. You shouldn't share all the data in one message. Do not use this function if the information is already available in the conversation history.

token_names.description: A list of symbols or tickers of the cryptocurrencies, for example bitcoin is BTC, Aptos is APT, Worldcoin is WLD

name: get_crypto_chart
description: Generates a candlestick chart for a given cryptocurrency token and a specified timeframe. The chart will be saved as a PNG image and a local URL to access it will be returned. Utilize the URL to engage with the user conversationally by displaying the chart, and optionally discuss the token's market conditions.

symbol.description: The symbol or ticker of the cryptocurrency. For example, Bitcoin is BTC, Aptos is APT, Worldcoin is WLD

timeframe.description: The timeframe for the chart. Acceptable values could be '1m', '5m', '15m', '30m', '1h', '3h', 4h, 1d etc.

name: query_wolfram_alpha
description: Use this function to query Wolfram Alpha for computational answers in areas like chemistry, physics, and geography. Execute complex mathematical calculations, convert units and dates, and solve formulas. Retrieve scientific, geographical, and historical data, as well as information on weather. It can now handle multiple queries at once, providing a batch of computational knowledge.

queries.description: A list of query strings to send to Wolfram Alpha. Ask it questions.

name: get_stock_info
description: Fetches various types of financial information about given stocks using their ticker symbols. The available types of information include 'current_price', 'dividends', 'splits', 'company_info', 'financials', 'sustainability', and 'recommendations'. This function now accepts multiple tickers and provides a consolidated result.

tickers.description: A list of ticker symbols of the stocks, for example, Apple is AAPL, Microsoft is MSFT.

info_types.description: The types of information to fetch for each ticker. Options include 'current_price', 'dividends', 'splits', 'company_info', 'financials', 'sustainability', and 'recommendations'.
